titleStmt.title: Greenes Arcadia, or Menaphon: Camillaes alarum to slumber Euphues in his melancholy cell at Silexedra Wherein are decyphered, the variable effects of fortune, the wonders of loue, the triumphs of inconstant time. A worke, worthy the yongest eares for pleasure, or, the grauest censures for principles. By Robertus Greene, in Artibus Magister.
Menaphon
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Stansby for I. Smethwicke, and are to be sold at his shop in S. Dunstanes Church-yard vnder the Dyall, in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: With an introductory epistle by Thomas Nash.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop in S. Dunstanes Church-yard vnder the Dyall, in Fleet-street
